meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside was fazing me.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected turn of events fazed her momentarily.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel fazing the cat made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the haunted house fazed the brave explorer.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look was fazing the students into silence.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel fear or anxiety
meanings.sent1: The horror movie fazed the young audience.
meanings.sent2: The dark alley at night fazed her more than she expected.
meanings.sent3: The ghost costume unexpectedly fazing the dog was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline was fazing him like a dark cloud overhead.
meanings.sent5: The eerie howl of the wind fazed the campers in the wilderness.

meanings.sent1: The constant noise from the construction site was fazing the residents.
meanings.sent2: The persistent mosquito buzzing around fazed him during the night.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey fazing the zookeeper was causing quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The unresolved issue kept fazing her thoughts like a nagging worry.
meanings.sent5: The broken air conditioner fazed the employees in the sweltering heat.
